alert.note: Alert for Alcona; Iosco (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 05 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Michigan, including the following counties, Alcona and Iosco. * WHEN...Until 215 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 PM EDT, Spotter reports and radar rainfall estimates indicate up to 5 inches of rain has fallen since 300pm across northeast Iosco...and southeast Alcona counties. Streamflows and stages have increased on areas river as a result. Additional rainfall will be spreading into the area through the evening hours. While the rainfall is not expected to be nearly as intense and persistent as it was during the afternoon...an additional 0.25 to 0.75 inch of rain is expected between 900pm and midnight. This will continue the threat for flooding into the early morning hours of Thursday. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tributaries to the Au Sable and Pine Rivers, Black River, Van Etten Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oscoda, Harrisville, Au Sable, Harrisville State Park, and Barton City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not drive into areas where water crosses the roadway.
